results.name: Triangle T(n,k) = sum of the k first n-th powers
comment: First term T(0,0) = 0 can be computed as 1 if one starts the sum at j=0 and take the convention 0^0 = 1.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: Sum_{j=0..n}((-1)^(n-j)/(j+1)*binomial(n+1,j+1)*T(n,j)) are the Bernoulli numbers B(n) = B(n, 1) by a formula of L. Kronecker. - _Peter Luschny_, Oct 02 2017
example: Triangle starts (using the convention 0^0 = 1, see the first comment):
maple: for n from 0 to 8 do seq(A215083(n, k), k=0..n) od; # _Peter Luschny_, Oct 02 2017
mathematica: Table[ HarmonicNumber[k, -n], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 05 2013 *)
xref: A215078 is the product of this array with the binomial array.
T(3,k) is the beginning of A000537.
T(4,k) is the beginning of A000538.
T(5,k) is the beginning of A000539.
